column36: The entity giving me directions, ita was like having a companion/friend
column37: The fact that the walls of the labyrinth were appearing and disappearing, they felt totally inconsistent and I couldn't really understand the labyrinth shape, furthermore the fact that the entity was 99% of the times bumbling against me
column38: First of all make the labyrinth walls more consistent and less appearing and disappearing (because this also caused me nausea I think), second make somehow the entity stay at some distance from the user, because I couldn't understand basically anything he was trying to tell me, because he was always bumping against me/ compenetrating my character
column39: I don't know if it's important or no, but I also asked to the guy before me, and for him it was the same, in this game the best strategy seemed to just ignore the entity and search the objects by ourself
column57: Joy, when he reached an objective (a green light)
column60: The fact that I was interacting with a physical robot, in a real maze, that way it felt way way more fun than with the VR (also because the maze was well defined and I didn't have any nausea cause by it)
column61: The fact that the robot seemed to totally ignore me, I don't know if it was just me or not, but it seemed like the best strategy for me was just to stay still and act like a wall for him not to go in the wrong direction rather than pointing to him in some way where to go
column62: Overall this part was a really nice experience, let's do things like this more often
